Subject: Chromebook distribution
Detail:
Jasmynn:

Thanks for meeting with me -- I'm glad to hear you are feeling better.

Here's what we have:


   - The communication I sent to staff is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wKXlVqxOWfdfbGaEFpH_-cKLX6eeyIgZgHPFaIMMsgA/edit?usp=sharing>
   - The communication I sent to parents is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Ezvry4Ziv008Hxg2tDlvb3oAzV8X8e4mgmOIeTV6jSg/edit?usp=sharing>
   - The revised distribution calendar (still tentative) is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1IaU5RlMgY65C9LUhXFRqfcQ19HMah0K_FS8ROGB6N3I/edit?usp=sharing>.
   I went 8th grade, then 6th, then 7th, but I pushed the rooms that don't
   currently have carts to the back end of the list. That would be Dunlap
   (8th), Minkens (8th), Calvin/Smith (6th), and Bhatia/Dew (6th)
   - The Response sheet for the Consent form is HERE
   <https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1-eoHHmgkEKKRWulIGkci77oONgogOk1TLgJWJ0FJ2FE/edit?usp=sharing>


   - We would like a quote on 5 more carts. That would allow us to have one
   cart in each advisory space and one in the main office for tardy scholars.
   As a reminder: kids are allowed to check their devices out to take them
   home, but the default will be for them to be left at school in the carts.
   This makes carts shared across multiple advisory spaces very impractical.
   - We will need locks for the front and back of each cart, so 22-32
   total. I would like locks that are sturdier than the ones we currently have
   -- those can be pulled off without a lot of trouble.

Something else occurred to me: If we want kids to leave these devices at
school, we should have your work in each PMA consist of collecting their
old device and ensuring that the new device for each kid who has the
consent completed goes into the cart. Is there any need for the kids to
handle the devices before the next school day? Let me know what you think.

I received your email about the labels and covers -- I will order those
next week.

Thanks! Hope you are back to full health soon.

Subject: sound issues on PD day
Detail:
Hi everyone,

I'm just writing to share that three of my facilitators today either had to
cancel or use their personal device in order to facilitate their sessions
today. I just learned of these issues today, but what they shared with me
is below. Thanks!

Courtney Tarver @ Butler said she had issues all week and had to keep
restarting her computer. She mentioned that part of her trouble was because
they are currently remote. She had to cancel her sessions.

Janna @ Rauner reported the same issue - having to restart and still not
working. She was on campus and ended up using another device.

Nikki Cavitt @ Noble Street reported the same issue. Victor had given her
another device, but that one then wouldn't start. She had to cancel her
sessions.

Subject: Q2 Network PD Feedback Survey
Detail:
Greetings Noble,



We hope you had a great Network PD! Our feedback survey is linked here
<https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1VHeQBhazIq9znIrAeWVrvBrfkLRRRhHPAQXLHkm6QF8/edit?usp=sharing>.
Please complete and submit the survey for each of your sessions. Your
feedback is greatly appreciated.



You may complete the ISBE Evidence of Completion Form
<https://www.isbe.net/Documents/77-21B_evidence_completion.pdf> for any
synchronous sessions you attend today. Please keep these for your records;
you do not need to turn them in to The Academics Team. While we are remote,
signatures are not required. Please reach out to Myra Mitchell
<mmitchell@nobleschools.org>  with any additional credentialing questions.



Thank you for providing your feedback, so we can continue to improve our
offerings and support.



Take care and Happy Holidays,


Dru

Subject: Support with forwarding emails
Detail:
Hi Hugo,

I hope you are well.

As an update, Nomalanga Shields will transition from Noble officially on
12/30/2021, and her last workday is this Friday, 12/17/2021. Starting on
12/20, may I have you forward all of her emails to Maria Lefkow Sorensen?

Additionally, after the winter break, I will be taking an extended leave
throughout January. Maria and Lorri will be stepping in to support me while
I am out of the office. Would it be possible to have my emails forwarded to
them starting on 12/20 as well? I will be receiving important updates from
donors and about grants, so I'd love to make sure someone from my team can
receive these when I am out.

Thank you for your support and please do not hesitate to let me know if any
questions or concerns come up.

Best,
Sandy

Subject: Intercom Not Working ALL YEAR-SAFETY HAZARD
Detail:
Hello all,

Our intercom has not been audible all year. We have sent multiple emails to
Johnson and Muchin Maintenance about this problem. One semester of the
school year has almost passed and there have been a multitude of Code
Oranges/Blues and a Red. When Lockhart gave the 8 minute long announcement,
our students missed out. I asked Johnson if we should move to an alternate
location in advance, but he thought the speaker was working. It wasn't.

At this point, I don't know what to do. We don't feel safe. Our students do
not feel safe. We have been reassured on multiple occasions not to worry
and that it is a top priority on the list of things to be fixed....and yet
it still does not work.

How can we expedite this process for the safety of our students?

Best,
*Francesca Tomic (she/her/hers)*
Multilingual Teacher
Noble Network Charter Schools

Subject: Dual credit Biology resources
Detail:
Hi team -

Parker and I just finished our call with Harold Washington regarding the curriculum for dual credit bio, and we have a few online resources that we’ll need for the course:  

(1) e-learning program (one for each student - 5): https://www.pearson.com/us/higher-education/product/Simon-Modified-Mastering-Biology-with-Pearson-e-Text-Instant-Access-for-Biology-The-Core-3rd-Edition/9780135308622.html?tab=overview  

(2) Electronic textbook teachers edition: https://www.pearson.com/us/higher-education/product/Simon-Instructor-Guide-Download-only-for-Biology-The-Core-3rd-Edition/9780135308769.html

I am including the help desk here in place of the main office order request in case the purchase requires being loaded directly onto student/teacher computers.  

cq

Subject: MiFi for SSM Issues
Detail:
Hey James!

In my newsletter this week, Bianca said that IT was manned with a few MiFis
to help with our connection to the CPS network. I have the blurb from her
below. How many do we have to supply the Learning Specialists? I wanted to
offer this as a way around the connection issues, but wanted to know how I
should go about it.

Thanks!


   -

   SSM sign-in issues (Ongoing): Our iTeam at the Network level has been
   working to resolve the issue so many have reported with logging into and
   navigating SSM. Additionally, they are working with CPS’s IT Department and
   have ruled out it is a Noble network/internet issue. Here are some updates
   and reminders…
   -

      All staff should report issues and occurrences directly to their IT
      Lead’s  help desk
      -

      An interim workaround; for those that can connect with a MiFi; we
      connect them manually to a printer so they can  print documents.  We will
      make sure the IT Leads have this option ready to try out immediately.
      -

      This appears to be a complex issue related to the CPS application and
      we will need to rely heavily on CPS/ITS for a solution, which
can take time

Subject: Testing Computers/Chromebooks
Detail:
Hey Veleta!

I hope the week is off to a good start!  We will be doing Q2 interim
testing starting Thursday for our Audio testers.

I am writing because I anticipating needing ~20 or so chromebooks or
computers for students to test on.

They have all been told to bring their personal chromebooks, but given how
last time went, we will need some spares. Last time they received the same
messaging and we needed about 20 computers.

I was told there were either laptops or chromebooks set aside for testing.
If this is the case, please let me know where to locate them.

If this is not the case, we will need to use the loaner comps from the
office and communicate that there aren't any loaners on Thursday.

Thank you for all you do, and please let me know when you get a chance.

Subject: 12th grade PJ party Friday
Detail:
Hi Eric and Dustin!

Since I am out this week, I wanted to give some notes for the 12th grade
Friday PJ party on Friday that you both will be running for the seniors
while other students are testing. I'm sorry I won't be there to help!!

The general gist is that all the seniors are in the SC for the day and
there are holiday movies playing, kids get to chill, and we order them
pizza!

1) Brian, including you to check that the student center tech is working to
show movies. I know we have been having some issues with it the past few
weeks. Thank you!! Eric/Dustin, if Brian tells us it isn't working, you can
move to LH (but that isn't quite as fun, so hopefully SC works!)

2) I was going to order pizza for the seniors during the PJ party from
DeArcos. I would reach out to the ops team if you want help coordinating
this. Just make sure that students distance themselves how they would
during lunch to eat when the pizza comes.

3) The 12th graders voted for holiday movies a few weeks ago. One of you
will have to hook up your computer to play the movies. If you have to rent
any of them on Amazon, fill out the reimbursement form or get the school

Subject: Browser Lockdown Modes
Detail:
Hi, Mr. Diaz

I have gotten questions regarding locking the browsers for when students
take assessments.  Currently, some students are going to other tabs while
taking assessments to look up answers.  I reached out to the Formative
folks to inquire about this, and this is the response I received:


   - Browser lockdown modes are available, but are designed to be used for
   infrequent, school-wide high stakes testing. They require a school IT
   administrator to turn it on and off, so it's not something the teachers can
   do at their leisure.


Is there a way you can do this?
